;

;How can a graduate prove that he is "flexibly employed"?

;

;The only proof Yang Yu, a 2023 graduate of a 211 university in Beijing, was asked to provide was a handwritten letter of guarantee, which read: I guarantee that my salary will be higher than 2,420 yuan per month after graduation. 2,420 yuan is the minimum wage in Beijing.

;

;It wasn’t until one month after Yang Yu graduated that the school informed him that the certificate was not valid enough.

;

;"Bank statements or transfer records of income, chat records about work situations, or photos of work scenes." At noon on August 5, 2023, the counselor sent a new request.

;

;This is not an afterthought on the part of the school. One day ago, the Ministry of Education issued a notice and dispatched multiple working groups to various provinces to conduct special employment verification, check the employment data self-check list, verify the self-check report, spot-check relevant employment supporting materials, and opened a supervision and reporting hotline and email address to detect any false employment information. Relevant universities and personnel will be held accountable for violations signed and certified.

;

;Flexible employment is the focus of this inspection. Yang Yu, who plans to become a food blogger, is one of them. In previous statistics on his graduation destination, he filled in an annual salary of 300,000-500,000 yuan. Yang Yu said that he really "thought about making this amount. Being an Internet celebrity is very profitable."

;

;He not only wants to do "eating broadcast", but also hopes to present the character of a blogger who loves life through long videos. However, the data for long videos is not ideal. Currently, the four videos he posted on a certain social media have the highest likes of 49.

;

;The 2024 school recruitment season has begun. After delaying entering the job market for a long time, some people have decided to get out of their confusion and re-enter the social chain.

;

;;“Flexible Employment”;

;

;Today, the real life of food blogger Yang Yu is like this:

;

;Monday to Friday , he and his girlfriend shared a two-bedroom apartment in a county near Zhengzhou. The apartment was located in a community with the best conditions in the county, but their lives depended on online loans.

;

;Early on Saturday morning, he first took the bus, then the subway, then the train, and returned to his hometown to teach children how to swim. This job was recommended by a friend at home who owns a swimming pool. Yang Yu likes this job because "he works less and makes more money."

;

;In the first week after confirming the shared tenancy, Yang Yu and his girlfriend purchased a large bag of oil, salt, sauce, vinegar and pots and pans from the supermarket, moved them from the supermarket to an electric car, and then took them home and moved them upstairs together. . "At that time, I thought that when I finally have my own home, I must cook a lot of my favorite dishes."

;

;But now his concept has changed, "I will measure my time according to the standard of making quick money. If you can earn 200 yuan an hour, then spending an hour cooking is a waste. It is better to spend 20 yuan to eat out.” He started visiting the neighborhood pizza parlor and gained weight compared to when he was a student.

;

;In the materials given to the counselor, Yang Yu wrote, "As a perfectionist, I have been constantly testing and adjusting to make myself more confident." He has been three I haven’t updated the video in months, and my phone is full of test shots.

;

;He himself is aware of the contradiction, "I plan to shoot a new video early the next morning, but the reality is that I usually turn off the alarm clock and go to sleep."

;

;Among the self-certified flexible employment methods, the "income guarantee letter" provided by Yang Yu is only an extremely niche one.

;

; Meng Lan, who graduated from a 211 college in Wuhan majoring in advertising, provided the transaction flow of selling idle items on Xianyu; Wu Xuan, a Chinese major from a normal college, provided screenshots of income and work chats Records to prove her identity as a freelance writer - she experienced failed postgraduate entrance examinations and failed autumn recruitment before graduation, and then decided to return to her hometown to become a freelancer.

;

;No matter food bloggers or online store owners, they are not their first choice. Postgraduate entrance examinations and editing examinations are. But Yang Yu has no specific review plan. His daily study time ranges from one hour to five hours. “Sometimes he doesn’t do much in a day, but the study time is just gone.”

;

;Meng Lan often doubted herself and even developed neurasthenia and depression. "After graduation, I felt sluggish every day and felt that I was incapable of doing many things well." Now she decided to fight for the next national examination and signed up for the national examination to get off work offline, "from 8 am to 10 pm every day."

;

;Since you have to take public and postgraduate entrance exams, why do you call yourself flexible employment? Meng Lan said that before graduation, the counselor and class teacher knew that she would continue to take the civil service exam. They interviewed Meng Lan on the grounds of college employment and suggested that she fill in "self-employment" and the job content was to open a store on Xianyu. "Some of my classmates from World War II were also interviewed by teachers and asked to fill in the form of flexible employment." According to Meng Lan's estimate, there are nearly ten people in the class who are in a similar situation.

;

;Yang Yu’s situation is more complicated. In May 2023, on the school’s employment statistics questionnaire, Yang Yu truthfully filled out “unknown employment direction”. Soon, the counselor contacted him and said that "the college leaders want to help."

;

;Two other students in the same major received assistance, and they both got interview opportunities from a unit in Beijing. When he arrived at the interview site, Yang Yu hesitated. "I don't want to go, the salary is low, and I hate working the night shift. The fundamental reason is that I don't want to work."

;

;So, the three students decided to tell the college that they wanted to do self-media. However, unlike Yang Yu, who thought he could earn three to five million, the other two were conservative in terms of annual salary. They filled in "50,000-100,000."

;

;;

;

;In November 2018, a "eating broadcaster" appeared in Hangzhou, Zhejiang. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;;Rising year by year;;;; Than;

;

;Bloggers, online store owners, and freelance writers are all flexible employment. According to relevant documents from the General Office of the State Council, flexible employment refers to flexible and diverse employment methods such as self-employment, part-time employment, and new employment forms.

;

;This formulation appeared in 2002. At that time, the Ministry of Education proposed in its employment work to "actively open up various channels such as temporary employment and flexible employment." Two years later, it was included in graduate employment statistics.

;

;From 2021, the "employment rate" of college graduates will be changed to the "graduation destination implementation rate", which includes the flexible employment rate, which coexists with the agreement and contract employment rate, entrepreneurship rate, and enrollment rate.

;

;One concept that needs to be clarified is that the Ministry of Education’s employment rate statistics are different from those of the National Bureau of Statistics, and it is the latter that is more commonly discussed in the media. "In the unemployment rate statistics of the Bureau of Statistics, only the unemployment rate of people who want to be employed is counted. In other words, people who have no intention of employment are not included in the denominator. However, the denominator of the employment rate statistics of colleges and universities is the total number of graduates, and there is no distinction between employment intention." Feng Xiliang, vice president of the China Labor Society and professor at the School of Labor Economics at Capital University of Economics and Business, pointed out.

;

;In employment statistics, there are more and more graduates with "flexible employment". According to Zhaopin recruitment data, the proportion of flexible employment among college graduates in 2022 has increased by 10.9% compared with 2021.

;

;“Flexible employment is indeed a development trend.” Feng Xiliang said, “In the past, flexible employment was mostly skilled work. Due to the development of information technology, new employment forms have emerged in recent years, relying on There are more and more flexible jobs in information networks."

;

;Another trend is the flexibility of standard employment. "The boundaries of jobs are becoming increasingly blurred, such as labor dispatch personnel and contract employees. Mobile work blurs the boundaries of previous positions."

;

;Feng Xiliang believes that the statistical standards of colleges and universities should also be adjusted with the development of the times. Three years ago, he suggested that relevant departments appropriately relax the statistical standards of flexible employment. Students who are suitable for the position and those who start their own businesses. For example, Yang Yu and Meng Lan.

;

;Flexible employment is becoming a "reservoir" in graduate employment rate statistics.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters noticed that taking universities in Hebei Province as an example, according to the employment quality reports released by each university, the flexible employment rate of undergraduates in Chengde Medical College, Baoding University, and Hebei Normal University for Nationalities in 2022 exceeded 50 %. Among them, the total number of graduates of Hebei Normal University for Nationalities in 2022 is 3,294, and the total number of flexible employment is 1,941, accounting for 58.93%.

;

;Feng Xiliang is cautious about the flexible employment rate of nearly 60%. According to Feng Xiliang's 2021 survey, about 14% of graduates choose flexible employment, of which about 70% are active, and about 30% are "passively" employed flexibly because they cannot find a suitable job or during the transition period. .

;

;In that survey, after completing 8,604 valid questionnaires in 30 universities, Feng Xiliang found that the flexible employment rates of different schools and majors vary. “Graduates of art and foreign language majors have flexible employment options. The proportion of employment is higher, and the flexible employment rate is higher in junior colleges than in undergraduate schools.”

;

;According to the "Half Moon Talk" report, some colleges and universities are cheating on their employment rates. Counselors told students in the WeChat group, "If you can't find a job, just write flexible employment when filling out the form" and "If you encounter a survey, just write "flexible employment" He said he was doing self-media." A counselor at a Beijing science and engineering 211 college also told a reporter from Beijing Youth Daily that some "edge balls" will be played in the employment rate, such as registering part-time jobs as flexible employment. This category does not require a tripartite agreement and can be counted. into the employment rate.

;

;In the routine verification of the employment rate of graduates of the Ministry of Education in 2023, flexible employment has become the focus of the verification.

;

;;

;

;On July 20, 2023, an outdoor night market job fair was held in Guanyun County, Lianyungang City, Jiangsu Province. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;;Verification;

;

;How to check flexible employment? Southern Weekend reporters noted that the main methods for verifying employment data in each province are intra-provincial inspections, self-inspections within schools, mutual inspections between colleges, and supervision and reporting.

;

;Take provincial inspections as an example. In early July 2023, the Hunan Provincial Department of Education issued a notice requiring schools with a flexible employment rate of more than 20% to submit a special inspection report. The report includes the reasons, inspection status, Correction results and other information.

;

;Some universities in Hunan Province have made this ratio even stricter. Hunan Institute of Technology proposed that secondary colleges with a flexible employment rate of more than 15% "need to strictly check the flexible employment categories and submit a written flexible employment verification report."

;

;Feng Xiliang analyzed that the Hunan Provincial Department of Education’s flexible employment rate red line may have been set with reference to the previous flexible employment situation of college students. According to statistics from the National College Student Information Consultation and Employment Guidance Center, flexible employment accounts for 16.9% of college graduates in the country in 2020, and 16.25% of college graduates in 2021.

;

;“But 20% is not an absolutely correct red line, and relevant departments can control it more flexibly.” Feng Xiliang said.

;

;At the school level, there are also "self-examinations" and "mutual examinations".

;

;On June 12, 2023, Jining Medical College issued an announcement stating that when secondary colleges conduct mutual inspections, flexible employment telephone interview verification must "achieve 100% coverage." The announcement also stated that the Shandong Provincial Department of Human Resources and Social Security will organize on-site cross-checks between colleges and universities five days before graduates leave school. The team will be led by the leader in charge of employment, carrying laptops and all employment certification materials, and will conduct cross-checks between schools. A list of inspection opinions and issues will be formed, and “if no problems are found during the inspection, but problems are discovered later in the inspection by the superior organization, the relevant inspection units shall bear joint and several liability.”

;

;Surveillance calls are another method of verifying employment rates. Southern Weekend reporters contacted seven colleges and universities through the published supervision and reporting hotlines, and the responses they received were all "no reports have been received from students so far." However, there is not much difference in the verification methods. A staff member of the Employment Office of Yunnan Special Education Vocational College told Southern Weekend reporters that if a student does not have a "formal job" but "his department and major report that he has a job or flexible employment", then the Employment Office "will step by step Downward, the responsible persons of departments, majors, classes, counselors and teachers are held accountable.”

;

;The verification process of student reports is somewhat difficult. The Employment Office of Inner Mongolia Agricultural University told Southern Weekend reporters that students choosing to report with their real names will be more conducive to the school's investigation and verification one by one. A staff member of the Employment Office of Inner Mongolia Normal University said that the Education Department had reported that there were anonymous reports from students at the school, but because the school was unable to obtain student information, it could only conduct a large-scale investigation to see whether teachers had said or done these things.

;

;;“;;Back to the social chain;;”;

;

;Neither really employed nor After preparing for the exam with all their strength, several flexible employment graduates interviewed revealed complex group characteristics.

;

;They all have certain financial security provided by their families. The family hopes that Meng Lan will continue to take the civil service exam next year. "We have not considered the option of working directly. Now I am preparing for the exam at home. I have no source of income, but I have sufficient support from my family."

;

;Wu Xuan’s father likes his daughter to cook for him at home. “He thinks it would be good for me to be a full-time daughter.”

;

;Feng Xiliang’s research found that family economic foundation, digital development and professional matching will all affect students’ tendency to choose flexible employment. "If parents have a certain financial foundation and can give their children space to develop freely, graduates will get more understanding and support. In addition, digital background is the biggest technical factor, and mastering digital technology provides a foundation for college students to find flexible employment.";

;Compared with flexible employment, Yang Yu and Meng Lan's status is actually closer to "slow employment", that is, they neither intend to find employment immediately nor continue their studies after graduation.

;

;According to the "2023 College Student Employability Survey Report" released by Zhaopin Recruitment in May 2023, among the 2023 graduates, the proportion of "slow employment" increased from 15.9% in 2022 to 18.9%, which is close to the overall rate. one-fifth of .

;

;“We are different from the older generation. We don’t have to worry about survival issues after graduation. I can go to graduate school, make money, start a business as a food blogger, or even take the civil service exam if I can’t. I have many options, so I won’t be anxious,” Yang Yu said.

;

;The trouble is that he still doesn’t know what he really wants to do. "Although there are many choices in front of me, I need to work hard for any future, and I have nothing now." Walking on the road, he is often swept away by a sense of emptiness, and has not yet adapted to the fact that he is no longer part of the social chain. "College students here". "I used to think it was not good to go to school for too long. After I graduated, I found that I didn't want to grow up and wanted to go to school more."

;

;Yang Yu’s latest food shop exploration material was shot on August 4. He made up his mind, “I will definitely post a new video within three days.”

;

;"My parents said before that if you don't pass the public examination, you can do whatever you want. But I still haven't done what I originally wanted to do. Sometimes, I don't know Is it the constraints of the family or the constraints of myself?" Meng Lan had been working as a contract photographer when she was in college. She once hoped that this love would turn into a long-term career, but now she is fully preparing for the public examination.

;

;Yue Changjun, deputy dean of the School of Education at Peking University, once wrote that in recent years, phenomena such as "postgraduate entrance examination fever", "graduate entrance examination fever" and "slow employment" among college graduates can reflect that graduates have not yet prepared for future employment. Be fully prepared in terms of capabilities.

;

;Feng Xiliang believes that the mentality of this generation of college students is closely related to the impact of the three-year epidemic. "Universities are spending their time during the epidemic. Classes and internships may be online. They are more inclined to use virtual networks to understand society and solve problems, and have little contact with the real society."

;

;True realization Wu Xuan, who wanted flexible employment, decided to go to work after two months of experience as a freelance writer.

;

;The income from freelance writing is neither stable nor considerable. Wu Xuan also noticed changes in her mental state. During the two months of free life, her willingness to work became less and less. "Lack of contact with others" People’s deep links are gradually closed.”

;

;After discovering that the flexible employment life was not in line with expectations, Wu Xuan finally chose to become a junior high school Chinese teacher in his hometown. Although the shift system restricted her freedom, she "finally felt that she had entered the social chain and was no longer so anxious."

;

;(At the request of the interviewees, Yang Yu, Meng Lan, and Wu Xuan are pseudonyms)

; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 20:25:14 +0800 癌症老人乘机被拒，哪些情况不能飞？川航称艾滋患者需报备http://www.infzm.com/contents/256689
;;2023-09-14 19:30:00;
;

;On September 12, a passenger with cancer was denied boarding when checking in at Chengdu Tianfu International Airport. . The passenger who was denied boarding was suspected to have been suffering from cancer for four months, according to live video captured by a bystander.

;

;The live video showed that at about 9:45 a.m. that day, at the boarding gate of flight EU2205, an elderly man was sitting in a wheelchair, and the man and the elderly woman, who were suspected to be family members, were sitting on the ground. The man shouted to the staff: "The commitment book has been signed and the hospital certificate has been written. I also brought a nurse with me. You won't let me leave."

;

;Subsequently, the man was suspected of working with another employee of the airline company. The staff called, "I have cancer, four months ago. You said before that you have no heart disease, no respiratory disease, no trauma, and everything is fine."

;

;After that, a reporter from Nandu called Chengdu Airlines Co., Ltd., and the customer service responded It is said that if the passenger has early-stage or mid-stage cancer, the flight can be carried, but if the passenger has late-stage cancer, the flight will not be carried due to restrictions on the aircraft's air transport environment, medical facilities and other conditions.

;

;According to inquiries from Nandu reporters, in the EU05 version of the "General Conditions for Domestic Transportation of Passengers and Baggage of Chengdu Airlines Co., Ltd.", "late-stage cancer patients" are indeed included.

;

;;

;

;Nandu reporter also I called the customer service of Chengdu Tianfu International Airport, but the other party said that they did not know about the matter and "it is up to the airline to explain."

;

;It is worth noting that Chengdu Airlines Co., Ltd. also stated that if the elderly person taking the flight is over 65 years old, , it is recommended to issue a health certificate at a hospital at or above the county level within 72 hours before boarding. Otherwise, if the ground handling staff thinks that the elderly person is "apathetic" when boarding, he may be refused boarding. After being refused boarding, "responsibility" Passengers need to bear the responsibility themselves."

;

;However, when Nandu reporters further asked about the criteria for judging "apathetic", customer service was unable to give a specific description. However, no relevant provisions were found in the "General Conditions for Domestic Transportation of Passengers and Baggage of Chengdu Airlines Co., Ltd."

;

;According to inquiries from Nandu reporters, various airlines have different standards for not accepting flights.

;

;According to the relevant provisions of the "Public Air Transport Passenger Service Management Regulations" issued by the Ministry of Transport in 2021: The general conditions of transportation should at least include: "Relevant regulations for passengers taking flights, including infants, pregnant women, and unaccompanied by adults" Carriage standards for special passengers such as children and seriously ill patients." In other words, airlines can set operating standards in this regard, but there are no specific regulations on what the specific standards are.

;

;For example, China Southern Airlines clearly stipulates that chickenpox patients cannot fly until the damaged area has recovered; cerebrovascular patients. For patients with cerebral embolism, cerebral hemorrhage, and brain tumors, the roar, vibration, and lack of oxygen during takeoff and landing can aggravate their condition and are prohibited from flying.  

;

;Sichuan Airlines Co., Ltd. stipulates that passengers who require special care due to physical reasons or who must meet certain conditions can only be transported in compliance with Sichuan Airlines’ transportation regulations, with Sichuan Airlines’ prior consent, and when necessary. Transportation will be accepted only after arrangements have been made. This includes seriously ill passengers, stretcher passengers, those who need premature infant incubators, and passengers with AIDS without any external injuries. They must present a medical certificate issued by a hospital recognized by Sichuan Airlines and signed by the passenger's doctor.

;

;;

;

;Xiamen Airlines The conditions for refusing to carry passengers are listed in more detail, including various medical parameters, postoperative time, etc. When a reporter from Nandu called Xiamen Airlines customer service to ask under what circumstances they would not be allowed to board the plane, the other party said, "Everyone can board the plane except those who drink alcohol. There are no clear regulations."

; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 19:55:03 +0800 台风拔树树砸车，谁来赔，怎么赔？物业保险、车损险与巨灾险了解一下http://www.infzm.com/contents/256671
;;2023-09-14 19:00:00;
;

;When disasters such as typhoons occur, they often cause heavy personal and property losses to local residents. According to the Beijing News, on September 2, this year's No. 9 Typhoon "Sura" landed in Guangdong at the level of a strong typhoon. Affected by the typhoon weather, many trees on the roadside on Beihuan Avenue, Futian District, Shenzhen were blown down by strong winds. , a car was hit by a tree, killing one person and injuring two others.

;

;According to a report by "City Zero Distance" in July this year, affected by Typhoon Taili, a banyan tree in the community where Mr. Lu lived in Zhongshan City was blown down and hit his car. The damage was very serious. In this regard, the property management said, "We hope that the owner will drive the vehicle to a maintenance point or 4S shop for repair as soon as possible. We have a 'public liability insurance' ourselves. After the owner completes the repair, he will report the quotation and catalog to us simultaneously, and we will report it to the insurance Company."

;

;Although the above two incidents were related to natural disasters, vehicles were smashed and even caused casualties. The parties involved and their families will definitely seek corresponding relief afterwards. Take the community as an example. There have been many disputes before about whether the property management company is responsible for being hit by a tree when a car is parked in the community.

;

;There is such a case in Beijing Haidian Court. The party involved, Mr. Zhang, said that it rained heavily that night and the tree fell down, causing damage to his vehicle parked in the community, and the roots of the tree had bulged out of the ground before it fell. Therefore, he filed a lawsuit with the court and requested the property company to compensate for various losses. . The property company argued that, first, the community involved in the case is a non-operating asset, it does not charge property fees and parking fees, and only provides minimum basic guarantees. The property company is not the owner or manager of the trees; second, the gardening department stipulates that private property rights are not allowed. Dealing with trees, so even if the tree roots bulged out of the ground before, it could not deal with it; thirdly, the heavy rain that night was force majeure. In addition, Mr. Zhang’s car has been repaired by insurance and cannot be compensated again.

;

;In this regard, the court held that the property management company was the property service company of the disputed community. Although it did not collect the property service fees or parking fees paid by the owners, it was still responsible for the equipment, facilities and equipment in the community. The manager of this matter is the manager of the broken tree in this case. Although the property company claimed that it was not at fault for the broken trees, the evidence submitted was not enough to prove that it had fulfilled its reasonable management and maintenance obligations for the trees involved, and both parties acknowledged that the roots of the trees involved had bulged out of the ground before the incident. But the property company did not deal with it. In addition, although there was heavy rain on the night of the incident, it was still a natural force. The property company’s defense that it was force majeure could not be established. Therefore, the property management company should bear corresponding responsibilities. However, because the vehicle maintenance fees claimed by Mr. Zhang have been compensated by insurance, the court cannot support Mr. Zhang’s request for the property company to pay him this part of the expenses.

;

;Regarding the property management responsibility for the trees in the community, Article 1257 of the Civil Code stipulates that if the owner or manager of the forest causes damage to others due to breaking, toppling, or falling fruit, etc., and the owner or manager of the forest cannot prove that he is not at fault, Should bear infringement liability. This shows that as long as they are within the community, trees are within the jurisdiction of the property. If the property owner refuses compensation on the grounds that it is subject to force majeure factors such as typhoons or heavy rains rather than daily management, the reason is untenable. Due to advance forecasts such as typhoons, property management companies should inspect and reinforce trees planted in ground-level open-air parking lots in advance to avoid damage.

;

;Obviously, the best way for property companies to avoid similar situations is to learn from the community properties reported in "Nanjing Zero Distance" and purchase property insurance.

;

;Property insurance means that the property pays insurance premiums to the insurance company, and both parties sign an insurance contract. After the occurrence of causes, accidents, and disasters within the scope of the contract, the insurance company will bear the compensation within the scope of the contract. Property insurance covers a wide range of areas. Among them, public liability insurance refers to the financial compensation liability for the victim that the insured party shall bear in accordance with the law due to damage to other people's personal or property due to his or her fault in public places. By purchasing this type of insurance, the insurance company will pay compensation if there are problems such as damage to vehicles or even people caused by trees in the community.

;

;Who will pay the premium? The "Regulations on the Administration of Property Service Charges" stipulates that property service costs or property service expenditures include shared parts of the property, shared facilities and equipment, and public liability insurance costs. That is, the property fees charged by the property to the owners include public liability insurance costs. Therefore, in the event of a "car being hit by a tree in a community" incident, the property owner should pay compensation first and then seek compensation from the insurance company.

;

;However, the judgment of the Beijing Haidian Court provides another solution. If car owners purchase car damage insurance (vehicle loss insurance), they can make claims on their own to the insurance company. According to the car damage insurance of an insurance company, compensation will be provided for vehicle losses caused by fire, explosion, collapse of external objects, falling objects in the air, lightning strikes, windstorms, tornadoes, heavy rains, floods, etc. However, car damage insurance is a voluntary insurance policy for car owners, and currently this model is still niche.

;

;In the Shenzhen case, because the accident occurred in a public area, according to the Civil Code, the owner and manager of the tree should also be held liable, unless they can fully prove that the cause of the accident was force majeure.

;

;In fact, catastrophe insurance can also cover the cost sharing of compensation for accidents involving trees hitting cars and people in this municipal area. As one of the first catastrophe insurance pilot cities in my country, Ningbo City has launched a catastrophe insurance pilot project in 2014. The Ningbo Civil Affairs Bureau, on behalf of the Ningbo Municipal Government, signed a catastrophe insurance contract with the Ningbo Branch of PICC Property and Casualty Insurance Company as the policy holder. , the protection content not only covers household property losses caused by typhoons, heavy rains, etc., but also includes personal injury and death liability.

;

;It can be seen that through the coverage of property insurance and the promotion of various types of insurance such as car damage insurance and catastrophe insurance, when disasters such as typhoons occur, resulting in losses of people and property such as trees hitting cars, etc., whether it occurs in the community Both indoors and in urban public areas, we can achieve the maximum goal of "no longer having to admit that we are unlucky in the event of a disaster."

; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 19:25:03 +0800 农业农村部：“村播”是乡村振兴的新型人才http://www.infzm.com/contents/256669
;;2023-09-14 18:00:00;
;

;;

;

;On September 8, 2023, fruit farmers in Zhuxi Town, Cengong County, Guizhou Province broadcast live Selling golden autumn pears. ;(People's Vision/Picture);

;

;Rural areas, like cities, have huge consumption potential. On September 12, 2023, Zhang Guoqing, deputy director of the Information Center of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs, said that farmers’ income has grown faster than urban residents for 11 consecutive years, and the township and village consumer markets account for 38% of my country’s total consumer market, but to To build a connection between resources and markets and promote the further development of rural economy, "village broadcasters" who use short videos and live broadcast tools are also needed.

;

;On the same day, Zhang Guoqing said in his speech at the Kuaishou Light Chasing Conference that as a new type of talent for rural revitalization, "village broadcasters" have brought the "source of living water" of talents to rural revitalization.

;

;The emphasis on "village broadcasting" is to a large extent inseparable from the development trend of Internet e-commerce. At a special press conference on August 15, 2023, Li Gang, Director of the Circulation Development Department of the Ministry of Commerce, introduced that in 2022, the national rural online retail sales will reach 2.17 trillion yuan, and the online retail sales of agricultural products will reach 531.38 billion yuan, which is similar to that in 2014. Compared with the same period last year, it increased by 11 times and 4 times year-on-year. By the end of 2022, the number of rural online merchants (stores) nationwide has reached 17.303 million, and the number of rural Internet users nationwide has exceeded 300 million.

;

;In Suning County, Hebei Province alone, a small county located at the western end of the central city of Cangzhou, more than 6,500 online fishing rod and fishing gear shops have already solved the employment problem for nearly a quarter of the local population.

;

;Li Chaohui, director of the Digital Economy Development Service Center in Suning County, Hebei Province, said that among the local 340,000 permanent residents, 30,000 are directly engaged in e-commerce, and 85,000 are indirectly engaged in packaging, video production and other related work. The products are online The sales rate is over 90%. ; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 16:55:03 +0800 中华儿慈会志愿者疑卷走近千万救助款，大病家庭再陷配捐骗局http://www.infzm.com/contents/256685
;;2023-09-14 16:40:00;
;

;;

;

;; (Visual China/Picture) ;

;

;Recently, the China Children’s Charity Aid Foundation (hereinafter referred to as the China Children’s Charity Foundation) was exposed that its “Hebei project leader” made off with tens of millions of aid funds, and the patients’ families were suspected of being defrauded.

;

;On September 13, 2023, parents who realized that they had been deceived came to the door of the Chinese Children's Charity Association again. Some family members told Southern Weekend reporters that they participated in the matching donation activities of Ke Mouxiao, the "Hebei project leader" of the Chinese Children's Charity Association. According to the early publicity, taking "48,500 to match 1,500" as an example, parents raise 48,500 yuan to "donate" to the designated account. After 20 days to a month, they can receive the principal plus 1,500 yuan in matching donations, a total of 50,000 yuan. Yuan.

;

;Many patients had participated in this project, and their families had no doubts. It was not until the end of August 2023 that the promised funds were not paid back, and they discovered that they had been cheated. Wang Jun, a family member of the patient, told Southern Weekend reporters that preliminary statistics from parents revealed that a total of 88 families had been defrauded, involving more than 9 million yuan.

;

;On the evening of September 13, the China Children’s Charity Association issued a statement denying that Ke Mouxiao was a staff member of the association and had never entrusted Ke Mouxiao to personally raise funds for the 9958 Children’s Emergency Relief Project (hereinafter referred to as 9958). funds. As for the 10 million yuan of funds circulated online, the statement stated that the association's account had never received these funds. "The person involved transferred the funds to Ke Mouxiao's personal account and received rebates from Ke Mouxiao's personal account." Staff of the Chinese Children's Charity Association told the media that Ke Mouxiao was a volunteer and the police had opened a case for fraud by impersonating him.

;

;;

;

;On September 13, the Chinese Children’s Charity Association issued a statement. ;(China Children's Charity Association official website/picture);

;

;The customary "matching donation"

;

;The afternoon of September 13 When Southern Weekend reporters came to the entrance of the Chinese Children's Charity Society in Beijing, some family representatives entered the Children's Charity Society office to communicate, while more family members of the children were waiting outside the hospital. Most of them take their children to seek medical treatment in other places, from Hubei, Hunan, Sichuan and other places to Hebei Yanda Ludaopei Hospital and Shandong Provincial Cancer Hospital for treatment, and rent houses near the hospitals.

;

;Li Yan’s child was diagnosed with neuroblastoma, a very rare childhood cancer, when she was two years old. For this reason, her family traveled from Sichuan to Shandong Cancer Hospital for treatment. In the past two years, the family has spent millions of yuan on treatment. "Immunotherapy costs hundreds of thousands a month, all at my own expense."

;

;After her child was diagnosed, Li Yan joined a patient group. In the patient group, she found that people often posted information on fundraising and matching donations for serious illness relief, and patients always participated.

;

;According to the pages displayed by some parents, the descriptions of these matching donation notices are simple, such as "101,500, matched with 2,500, repayment in one month" and "There is only one quota this month, sign up if you want." Li Yan said that the amount of matching donations is different each time, and the number of participants is also different. Taking a 49,000 yuan matching donation of 1,000 yuan as an example, parents will raise 49,000 yuan themselves to invest in the project, and they must also provide a 50,000 yuan medical invoice in order to receive a 50,000 yuan return.

;

;Many parents said that the matching donation rebates were sometimes transferred back to the parents’ personal accounts, and sometimes were transferred directly to the hospital’s designated account. Parents used the reimbursement documents to write them off one by one. “They can’t take them out, they can only use them. Treated in hospital."

;

;For parents, having a seriously ill child at home is a heavy burden. "A cold for ordinary people is just a trivial matter. For them (leukemia patients), it may cost tens of thousands of dollars to treat." Chen Chen, another parent at the scene, said that his 12-year-old daughter suffers from myeloid leukemia and is only a child. A box of targeted drugs costs more than 30,000 yuan. "We are very willing to match the donation of 1,000 or 2,000 yuan to pay the rent and improve the food."

;

;In the process of taking care of the children, the families of the children shared their treatment experience, comforted and understood each other, and formed a A different sense of trust. Li Yan calls the patients who were diagnosed earlier as "seniors". She knows that some patients have been making matching donations for several years, and they all get their money back normally.

;

;Other patients value the "signature" of Project 9958. It is organized by the Chinese Children's Charity Association and is known to almost all families of children with the disease. When soliciting parents to make matching donations, organizers will ask whether they have been registered. "Filing" refers to entering the files of the Children's Charity Society 9958 project. Parents scan the QR code to fill out the "Chinese Children's Charity Society 9958 Children's Emergency Rescue Center Application Form (Langfang)" and provide the child's name, age, condition and other information.

;

;“You know that many people have done this before, and everyone has a default attitude towards this matter.” Li Yan said that it was this normalized operation method and the mutual trust between patients that made her enthusiastic about the project. There is no doubt about the authenticity. In addition, seriously ill children require careful care, and parents are devoted both physically and mentally to their children, making it difficult to have the energy to verify the authenticity of the project.

;

;On August 25, Li Yan and several patients at Shandong Cancer Hospital transferred 48,500 yuan to Zhang’s account. Zhang transferred the money layer by layer and remitted it to Ke Xiao, and it was agreed on September 15 Refund of 50,000 yuan. But in early September, they learned that the previous batch of patients' money had not been paid back in time, and Ke Mouxiao had also lost contact. Only then did they realize that the money could not be recovered.

;

;Wang Jun, whose family members were being treated at Ludaopei Hospital in Yanda, Hebei Province, told Southern Weekend reporters that after Ke Mouxiao failed to pay his patients back in time on August 30, more than a dozen family members came to Ke Mouxiao to ask for an explanation. After Ke Mouxiao refused many times, the parents jointly reported the case to the police in Yanjiao, Hebei Province. After the police filed the case, they took criminal detention measures against Ke Mouxiao. After the accident, the families of the children asked each other. Most parents participated in the projects of "48,500 for 1,500," "101,500 for 2,500," and "126,000 for 4,000." "The minimum investment was 48,000, and the most was more than 300,000."

;

;;

;

;Information records of the patient’s family members participating in the “matching donation” project. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Volunteers of "Best Leadership"

;

;In fact , similar charity matching scams have appeared many times. (;For details, please see Southern Weekend's report;;"The whereabouts of millions of dollars are unknown, and leukemia families are suspected of "charitable donation" scams";;;) This incident has attracted widespread attention, perhaps because of the large amount and involvement Chinese Children's Charity Association.

;

;The China Children’s Charity Aid Foundation was established in 2010. It is a national public foundation under the supervision of the Ministry of Civil Affairs. It mainly provides assistance to children in need and those who have no one to support them in the aspects of medical care, growth, education, culture and sports, etc. Carry out assistance activities for children, left-behind children, street children, etc.

;

;The 9958 Children’s Emergency Relief Project was established in 2012. It is a self-owned brand project of the China Children’s Charity Association. This project serves the group of children in need aged 0-18 years old, integrating information services, financing channel services, Three major functions of rescue execution services. According to the official website of the China Children's Charity Association, 9958 has currently established more than 50 cooperation projects, established an emergency rescue channel network and 25 rescue sub-centers across the country.

;

;According to the statement of the Chinese Children’s Charity Association, Ke Mouxiao only served as a short-term volunteer in the association’s 9958 Children’s Emergency Relief Project Hebei Langfang Regional Cooperation Agency, and the parents’ transfer was made to Ke Mouxiao personal account. Southern Weekend reporters learned at the scene that the fundraising matching donations of the parents interviewed were indeed not transferred to the public account of the 9958 project, but were transferred to multiple different personal accounts.

;

;Despite this, parents all believe that Ke’s filial behavior is related to the Children’s Charity Association. Many parents told Southern Weekend reporters that to participate in the matching donation project for the first time, they must scan the QR code and fill out the "Chinese Children's Charity Association 9958 Children's Emergency Rescue Center Application Form (Langfang)". Pan Changrong, 60, said that his grandson was being treated at Lu Daopei Hospital for leukemia. Their information It has been entered into the system of the Children's Charity Association, "indicating that the code is real."

;

;In addition, the family members said that the statement of matching donation receipts showed that the appropriator was the China Children's Charity Society, and based on this, they believed that these matching donation projects were regular projects operated and implemented by the China Children's Charity Society. However, no parents showed relevant payment receipts to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Wang Jun said that before September 7, parents could still see Ke Mouxiao’s personal introduction on the official website of the Chinese Children’s Charity Association, indicating that he was the director of the Langfang team of the 9958 project, but on 9 When formally communicating with the Chinese Children's Charity Association on March 8, parents discovered that the relevant information had been deleted from the official website.

;

;At the same time, the person in charge of the China Children's Charity Association also issued a contract termination document to the family members who came to communicate. The contract termination document stated that "the contracting agency of Langfang Rescue Station of Children's Charity Society's 9958 Rescue Project is Tianjin Beichen District Tianjuan Public Welfare Service Center. Because the rescue volume did not meet the standards and did not meet the development needs of the 9958 Children's Emergency Rescue Project, after evaluation, The contract with the Langfang Rescue Station was terminated on March 31, 2023. After the termination of the contract, any nominal fundraising, publicity and other activities conducted by the 9958 Rescue Project Langfang Rescue Station have nothing to do with the 9958 Children's Emergency Relief Project of the China Children's Charity Society." Southern Weekend reporters saw from the photo that the document was stamped with the official seal of the Children's Charity Association and was signed on March 31, 2023.

;

;Wang Jun said that after the case was filed and accepted by the police, the police asked the person in charge of the project of the Chinese Children's Charity Association about this situation, and the other party admitted that the termination letter was issued in the past two days.

;

;Wang Jun pointed out that there is still an article on the national online platform training event released in February on the public account of 9958 Children's Emergency Rescue, with a picture showing that Ke Mouxiao was awarded the "China Children's Charity Association" Best Leadership Award 2022”. During the signing ceremony, it was Ke Mouxiao who signed the contract and took a group photo as the representative of the Langfang team.

;

;On the afternoon of September 13, staff of the China Children’s Charity Association stated that they were temporarily unable to accept interviews from Southern Weekend reporters, and the above information could not be confirmed. In a subsequent statement, the Chinese Children's Charity Association did not explain the above information. It only mentioned that Ke Mouxiao was currently detained by the Yanjiao Public Security Bureau of the Sanhe City Public Security Bureau in Hebei Province and was under investigation. They also reported to the public security organs. Report and actively cooperate with the public security organs in their investigations.

;

;Family representatives who communicated with the Chinese Children's Charity Association told Southern Weekend reporters that the Chinese Children's Charity Association told parents that the case has been criminally filed and they need to wait until the police investigation is completed to determine how much money can be recovered. How much compensation to pay. "But many families can't wait that long, and their children are in the hospital."

;

;On the same day, Tencent Charity and Sina WeChat Public Welfare issued respective responses, saying that the suspected fraud of 9958 did not occur on the platform, but based on In accordance with the platform operating rules, industry self-discipline conventions and user-oriented principles, fundraising for all 9958 projects has been suspended pending the investigation results of government departments, and further processing will be carried out based on the results. After checking, Southern Weekend reporters found that a total of 2,939 9958 projects were launched on Tencent’s public welfare platform, and all of them are currently marked “fundraising ended.”

;

;(The patient’s family members in the article are pseudonyms, and Southern Weekend reporter Wang Xuqiulin also contributed)

; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 16:55:03 +0800 AI火爆之下，英属小岛安圭拉为啥躺赚了一笔横财？http://www.infzm.com/contents/256613
;;2023-09-14 16:00:00;
;

;The global popularity of artificial intelligence (AI) has brought Some interesting surprises. While OpenAI was still losing money, a British island in the Caribbean actually made money.

;

;This place is Anguilla. With an area of ​​only 96 square kilometers and a population of only 16,000, it earned Al dividends because the top-level domain name suffix in Anguilla is .ai. AI is booming and a large number of startups have registered product URLs with the .ai suffix. A .ai domain name costs about $70 per year. As a result, Anguilla got a pie that fell from the sky. This year's government revenue is expected to surge by US$30 million, equivalent to 10% of annual GDP.

;

;The highest management organization for domain names in the world is called ICANN (Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers), the Chinese abbreviation for Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers. It is an established A non-profit international organization in October 1998. Originally a non-profit organization under the U.S. Department of Commerce, the U.S. government announced in 2016 that ICANN would no longer be affiliated with the Department of Commerce and become a self-managed independent organization. Of course, the United States certainly has a lot of influence on it.

;

;ICANN is responsible for managing the operation of the world's domain name system. One of its main tasks is to formulate the top level domain name (top level domain) and stipulate which strings can be used as top level domain names. The so-called top-level domain name (TLD) is the highest-level domain name, which is the last part of the website address. For example, .com, .cn. Today's domain name types can be divided into three major categories. One is .com, .net, .org, .info, .biz, etc., which can be said to be global domain names. The second is country or regional domain names, such as .cn Chinese domain name, .us American domain name, .uk British domain name, .de German domain name, etc., which are only two letters in length. The third is new top-level domain names, such as .top domain name, .vip domain name, .xyz domain name, .app domain name, .site domain name, etc., with suffix length starting from 3 characters.

;

;ICANN cannot manage more than a thousand domain name suffixes by itself, and it is not appropriate to charge this money for being both a referee and a player, so ICANN provides services for every top-level player. Find a reliable registry (host) for the domain name, which will be responsible for managing the server, registration, use, fees and other matters of this domain name. A registry can also manage multiple domain name suffixes at the same time.

;

;Verisign currently manages the .com domain name suffix. Verisign also manages the .cc domain name, .net domain name, and .tv domain name. . Generally speaking, for security reasons, country or regional domain names will be managed by ICANN to the government organizations of the country or region. The China Internet Network Information Center (CNNIC) manages the .cn domain name suffix. CNNIC also manages the China Internet Network Information Center (CNNIC). domain name. The domain name registry only has management rights and cannot participate in market transactions. Therefore, there are many domain name registrars under the Domain Name Registry, including Alibaba Cloud, Yuming.com, Tencent Cloud, Baidu Cloud, etc. in China.

;

;Country or regional domain name registration usually requires payment of a certain fee, which depends on the type of domain name, top-level domain name and registrar. Registration fees are usually annual and require periodic renewal to maintain ownership of the domain name. The price of a domain name is determined by the domain name registry. For example, the price of cn domain name is determined by China Internet Network Information Center (CNNIC). This is the cost price of the domain name. After the domain name registry sets the bulk registration price (wholesale price) for domain name suffixes, the domain name registrar service platform will charge corresponding registration fees and a certain percentage of service fees based on this standard. Domain name registrars have to complete the real-name authentication of domain names and domain name resolution services on behalf of the government, and earn hard-earned money.

;

;So, a large part of the money Anguilla earns should be due to the country or local hosting companies raising prices. In Deyue, local people registered some domain names and then sold them to the companies that wanted them first.

;

;However, for hosting providers, the higher the domain name price, the better. First of all, the supply of domain names is actually unlimited. There can be countless domain names in front of a top-level domain name suffix. Therefore, if the hosting agreement is set too high, the sales volume will be reduced, and the total revenue may be reduced. Secondly, domain names still have certain alternatives. For example, you can use .com, .cn, and .net.

;

;A good domain name plays an important role in gathering corporate visibility and popularity. More importantly, the domain name is the identity mark in the Internet era and has "uniqueness". This becomes an asset. Generally speaking, domain name registration is based on a first-come, first-served principle. Whoever registers it early belongs to it. If a latecomer needs it, he or she will have to pay for it.

;

;For enterprises, especially large enterprises, domain names are a signal of strength. The reason is very simple. If a company does not have the most suitable domain name for itself, then the domain name must have been registered and the company does not have the strength to buy it back. Therefore, Internet companies are highly dependent on domain names. JD.com, Xiaomi, and Apple all spend a lot of money to buy domain names that are more suitable for them. It has been reported that Apple paid approximately US$1.5 million to acquire the domain http://icloud.net; earlier it spent a huge sum of nearly US$5.2 million for http://icloud.com.

;

;Of course, this kind of domain name registration is not a first-come, first-served basis without a bottom line.

;

;According to Article 8 of the "China Internet Network Information Center Domain Name Dispute Resolution Measures", you can complain about some domain name registrations. For example, the domain name complained of is the same as the name or logo in which the complainant has civil rights and interests, or is similar enough to cause confusion; the domain name holder complained of does not have legitimate rights and interests in the domain name or its main part; the domain name holder complained of has no legitimate rights and interests. Someone registers or uses the domain name with malicious intent.

;

;Article 9 also stipulates the malicious registration or use of domain names. For example, the purpose of registering or transferring a domain name is to sell, lease or otherwise transfer the domain name to the complainant or its competitor who is the owner of the civil rights and interests in order to obtain improper benefits; repeatedly use the name of another person who has legitimate rights and interests; or The logo is registered as its own domain name to prevent others from using the name or logo in which it has legitimate rights and interests in the form of a domain name on the Internet; the domain name is registered or transferred to damage the complainant's reputation, disrupt the complainant's normal business activities, or confuse the complainant. and the complainant, misleading the public.

;

;However, it should be pointed out that "registering a domain name with the purpose of selling or leasing" is no longer a criterion for judging malicious intent. For example, it is legal to register an Apple domain name first, and it is legal to sell it to Apple, but it cannot be sold to Apple's competitors.

;

; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 16:25:04 +0800 《过往人生》：所有分手，皆是前世http://www.infzm.com/contents/256621
;;2023-09-14 15:00:00;
;

;;

;

;The English title of the movie "Past Lives" (;Past Lives;) is a pun, which is both past life and plural. previous life. This shortlisted film for the main competition of the 2023 Berlin Film Festival has recently been praised by many audiences.

;

;When Nora reunited with Haisheng, a boy who had first fallen in love at the age of 12, after 24 years of separation, she had already changed her English name. On Nora's left hand side, her husband, American Jewish writer Arthur, sat, speaking English to him; on Nora's right hand side, Hae Sung, who had miraculously transformed from a child into a mature man, spoke Korean to him. .

;

;Nora and Haisheng discussed that the reason why they can sit here is because they were full of bonds in their previous lives. In those previous lives, they were either a princess secretly in love with her servant, or two people who did not love each other and betrayed each other due to family marriage, or they just happened to be seated next to each other on the train, or they were a bird and the person who carried it. Early morning tree branches. When they parted, they said that this moment might also be the past life. Because the past life is not only the talk of karma in Buddhism, but also a parallel time and space of imaginary, regretful, and missed possibilities. Since their relationship in this life is still full of shortcomings, then think of it as a vague past life, think of it as something that has happened and been written, rather than something that is being created, think of it as a dream and a bubble. Not vividly. What will be their afterlife? No one knows the answer.

;

;;Three past lives or parallel time and space;

;

;In the tetralogy of the Japanese writer Mishima Yukio's posthumous novel series "The Sea of ​​Plenty" , the reincarnation of past life, present life, and afterlife slowly unfolds in a bizarre and reasonable way. It is a completely different view of time from the West. All tragedies can always be soothed by the endless world of possibility.

;

;In the film, at the age of 12, Nora is still called Moon Na-young in Seoul. Her father is a director and her mother is an artist. She is a cultural elite and middle class in South Korea, and she decided to immigrate to Canada with her family. Hae Sung was Na Young's classmate in elementary school, because Na Young always came first in the exam. Once Hae Sung got the first place in the exam, Na Young became a crybaby. When her classmates asked her why she wanted to immigrate, she said it was because Koreans could not win the Nobel Prize for Literature. Naying drew a bird on Hae Sung's arm with a colored pen.

;

;At the age of 24, Nora accidentally found a post looking for her on her father's Facebook page. Haisheng had been looking for Naying online, but she had already changed her name to Nora Moon. The two communicated through text messages, made video calls, and crush each other again, their hearts pounding. For a while, their relationship was like an exotic online relationship. In order to adapt to Haesheng's time zone, Nora changed her schedule and got up early to talk to him. When Haesheng was riding the cable car in Namsan, he would also make video calls to Nora and show her Seoul from the air. landscape. But the signal in the air was unstable. After the connection was disconnected, Nora's expression seemed to be worried that something might happen to Hai Sheng. The network's Aladdin's lamp withdrew its promise to her, and Hai Sheng was imprisoned in the darkness of the screen.

;

;Haisheng said to Nora, your Korean is really bad. She said, I only speak Korean to my mother and you. Online dating will always come true one day. Nora hopes that Haisheng will come to New York, where she has dreams of drama and writing. But what she wants now is not the Nobel Prize for Literature, but the Pulitzer Prize. Haisheng is going to China for exchange. He has always wanted to learn Chinese because it will be useful in the future. Is the distance between the two just the vast Pacific Ocean?

;

;At the age of 36, Haisheng came to New York under the pretext of traveling, but actually he made a special trip to visit Nora. Nora has been married to Arthur for seven years. Compared with Hai Sheng, Arthur looks ordinary and is used to wearing worn jeans and brown jackets. He is a writer. Of course, he will not take a yacht to see the postcard scenery like the Statue of Liberty like a tourist. But after learning that Nora is accompanying him on the sea Sheng had been to this travel project, but felt a little bit disappointed. He met Nora at a creative writing residency and got married for Nora's green card. Arthur asked Nora if our story was a little too plain. You only spoke Korean in the dream, which was a world I couldn't understand.

;

;Nora finally sent Hai Sheng to the street where he was waiting for the bus. The two of them were silent for two minutes, one meter apart, as if this meter was the Pacific Ocean. For two minutes, they had no kiss, no lingering affection, no confession. They had never become true lovers. It was not until the car came that they had a hesitant courtesy hug.

;

;Why these two minutes of silence are touching? Perhaps no one said it better than the American writer Salinger: "Some people think that love is sex, marriage, a kiss at six o'clock in the morning. Pile of children, that may be true, Miss Leicester. But you know what I think? I think love wants to touch and then withdraws its hand."

;

;;There is no paradise, no paradise on earth< /strong>;

;

;Celine Song, the director of "A Life in the Past," must be no stranger to Salinger. She is a writer of Korean descent in Canada. She came to New York to do theater in her twenties and wrote this story based on similar experiences. A few years ago, she was sitting with her American husband and her childhood friend at a bar in New York's East Village, and she kept translating for them. Song felt the eyes around him sizing up this strange trio, so he started talking about it in the voice-over at the beginning of the film.

;

;Song loves romantic dramas. She feels that what drives romantic dramas are often adults who act like children. She hopes that the characters will show what love is like when everyone reveals their feelings for each other. .

;

;When Korean-American actress Greta Lee, who plays Nora, read the script, she couldn't help sobbing and had to continue reading with difficulty while crying. Although Greta Lee is a second-generation immigrant born in the United States, she can obviously understand the double dilemma of Asians in North America.

;

;Nora told Arthur that in New York, she knew many Korean Americans, but Haisheng was not like them. He was an authentic Korean. However, when chatting with Hai Sheng, she also became more Korean. Nora asked Hai Sheng why he was not married yet. She seemed to have completely lost the New York artist's tolerance for multiculturalism and marital status, and asked her compatriots in a conservative way of thinking. .

;

;In fact, the difference in life choices between Hai Sheng and Nora is a metaphor for Korean society: Hai Sheng studied practical engineering and came to China, which has deep historical roots with South Korea and broad economic prospects. Exchange; Nora studies literature and drama and wants to pursue her ambitions in New York, a global cultural center.

;

;When Nora said that the reason for immigration was that "Koreans cannot win the Nobel Prize for Literature," this line with quite a comedic effect revealed a common anxiety among residents of the third world. : On the one hand, they are full of recognition and admiration for the literary achievements represented by the Nobel Prize in Literature; on the other hand, they unconsciously fall into the inevitable Western-centrism trap of the Nobel Prize selection mechanism. The self-hate contained in the negative sentence "Koreans can't get..." is behind the distrust of the social structure, cultural system, and overall creativity of backward areas. But when she broke away from Korea and wrote in English, when she was identified as a North American Asian, she was forever stuck in the middle state of being neither a Korean writer nor an American writer. She and Arthur moved in together because they could save money by renting together, and they got married early because of the immigration policy. Nora asked, is this really the life that their parents expected their daughter to live when they immigrated?

;

;Douban netizen Toska said in a short comment: "The thing that makes me feel most uncomfortable in "A Past Life" is the undercurrent of superiority. New York is better than Toronto, Toronto is better than Seoul, and she is better than or equal to the United States. Koreans, American Koreans are better than Koreans (a word used in the movie is Korean Koreans, the former word is Korean in the cultural sense, and the latter word is Korean in the ethnic sense), "The scary thing is that I think The creator himself is not aware of it, but he feels wronged. He sings about his own barren experience and feelings without self-reflection." This may provide another angle to think about the film.

;

;The opening film of this year's Busan International Film Festival "I Hate Korea" is adapted from the novel "Out of Korea". The protagonist Guina is a person with average education, work and appearance. Everything in the future is doomed. No miracle happened, she said: "The person South Korea loves is itself, not me. It only loves those who make it shine... and it avoids those who shame it."

;

;With the same theme of separation, the protagonist of "Out of Korea" wants to escape involution and class solidification, Nora of "My Life" is looking forward to being on the world stage, and Hae Sung, who stays in Korea, wants to成为“更优秀”的人，即便身体辛苦，精神也不肯认输。真正的问题是，不论在哪片土地，都不能期待一个人间天堂，没有一劳永逸的乐土，只有永恒的困境。

;

;海盛问诺拉，假如你12岁时没有出国，假如我24岁时来到了纽约，会有什么不同？也许，正因为他们24年来只有两度惊鸿一瞥，没有陷入生活的琐屑、放大彼此的缺点，这缺憾才完美而迷人，值得诺拉失声痛哭，一边是不完美的祖国的完美的初恋，一边是完美的乌托邦的不完美的日常，她徘徊在曼哈顿的街区，也徘徊于无地。

; Thu, 14 Sep 2023 14:55:03 +0800 当买不起LV包的年轻人入手了百元高奢包装袋http://www.infzm.com/contents/256534
;;2023-09-14 14:00:00;
;

;;

;

;;（IC photo/ 图）;

;

;;身着最新款香奈儿外套，戴上珍藏版卡地亚手表，拿起爱马仕的“梦中情包”，感受一番娇兰香水的沁人芳香后，正式踏出家门——这是不知多少男孩女孩心中的“奢华;都市梦”。

;

;此前，一则“浙江人1年花18亿买香奈儿”的帖子引发热议，杭州大厦的香奈儿门店去年销售额达到了18亿元。包括香奈儿在内的一众奢侈品标榜着“有钱”，网友调侃：“贫穷限制了我的想象，有;钱人这么多，为什么不能多我一个。”;

;

;;“普通商场没啥;人，奢侈品店却排起长龙。”对于奢侈品门店，不少网友有着此类感受。

;

;纵观全国，无论是北京、上海，还是其他城市，爱马仕、香奈儿、古驰等奢侈品品牌的门店常常人满为患，新品发布时更是堪比大型“检票”现场，和普通品牌门店里三三两两的顾客相比，可谓是冰火两重天。

;

;;中国的奢侈品热：;;吸睛、吸金千层套路;

;

;;奢侈品在国际上被定义为“一种超出人们生存与发展需要范围的、具有独特、稀缺、珍奇等特点的消费品”,又称为非生活必需品。然而，消费低迷的环境似乎并没有影响“死忠粉”们对这一“非生活必需品”的抢购热情。;

;

;;以路易威登的一;款手袋来说，法国地区售价为一万七千元，在中国内地要卖到两万四千元。除了在门店外大排长龙，还有一群人默默地点开了海外代购平台的页面。

;

;作为世界奢侈品消费的重要力量，品牌扩张的路上少不了中国市场这块“香饽饽”。《2022中国奢侈品报告》显示，2022年中国人奢侈品市场销售额达9560亿元，同比略微下滑4%，在全球奢侈品市场占比高达38%，其重要性可想而知。

;

;不只是贵，奢侈品的价格还“一路狂飙”。去年11月，香奈儿将所有产品的价格上调3%到11%，据时尚网站Purse;Bop统计，低端奢侈品的年均涨幅约4%，高端奢侈品则在15%到18%。;

;

;;虽然价格“涨涨涨”，奈何抵不住买主的热情，抢购奢侈品俨然成为了一种备受追捧的时尚。;

;

;;

;

;;“追奢”背后，是奢侈品品牌倾力打造的;“吸睛”“吸金”双管齐下的千层套路。

;

;随着“元宇宙”概念的火热，众多品牌将目光投向了这一新鲜玩法。古驰曾与游戏平台Roblox合作，开设古驰快闪店，推出一款数字版古驰酒神包被炒至4100美元，比实体包高出700美元。而巴黎世家也为游戏《堡垒之夜》多个角色制作虚拟服装，玩家花8美元就能穿上“正版皮肤”;。;

;

;;“这钱不花白不花，现实中买不起，就游戏里享受享受呗。”资深的游戏玩家小罗谈及购买“皮肤”的看法时提及。;

;

;;不仅如此，普拉达、路易威登、博柏利等品牌都纷纷试水“元宇宙”。这波操作免不了网友调侃：“现实里的韭菜;割不完，又来割'元宇宙'的韭菜了。”

;

;打破消费次元壁还不够，“它经济”的火热风口同样少不了奢侈品的身影。所谓“宠随主贵”，不少猫狗在宠主的“万般宠爱”下享受着奢华猫/狗生。五千元的牵引绳、两万元的宠物便携包、一万七千元的宠物床……爱马仕推出的宠物用品，主打一个“金贵”，“这年头，狗都比我有钱。”宠主小方在社交媒体上评论，“怎么连宠物也内卷，哭了。”

;

;;

;

;;当然，奢侈品品牌不会放过任何的潜在消费者。除了箱包、服饰、珠宝这些传统项目，手机壳、耳机套、钥匙扣等小物件也悄然而出。某种草博主在小红书上写道：“买不起五位数的路易;威登包包，还买不起周边？冲冲冲！”不知有多少买主上了头。

;

;翻开奢侈品品牌的商品目录，还可以看到不少的新奇产品：棺材、装尸袋……款式丰富、价格昂贵。网友脑洞大开：“这难道就是;传说中的'优雅地死去'？”;

;

;;

;

;;（;;IC pho;;to / 图）;

;

;;年轻人玩高奢：;;二手买卖、大牌小样;

;

;;奢侈品消费水平与城市经济实力有着密不可分的关系。《2019奢侈品行业洞察报告》显示，中国内地奢;侈品消费水平城市排行榜中，北京和上海被分别位列第一和第二。

;

;在爱马仕的全国53家门店中，除去港澳台共20家门店，北京和上海分别达到了5家，占据中国内地门店数量的近1/3。

;

;而在这些买主中，高净值群体（中国内地拥有千万元人民币资产）是消费“顶流”，他们和“奢侈品”像是双向奔赴的最佳拍档。不过，如今奢侈品消费者不只是传统的“高端局买家”，包括数量巨大的年轻人，都能成为买主。

;

;报告显示，中国奢侈品市场的90后成为了奢侈品消费的主力军，占总体市场消费人群的50%。与此同时，贝恩奢侈品研究报告曾预测，到2025年，千禧一代及25岁以下的消费者将成为奢侈品消费市场的主力军，占比将达65%至70%。

;

;作为潜力派的年轻人，奢侈品品牌为打通他们在数字营销方面下了不少功夫——68%的年轻人会被明星或博主所发布的内容“种草”，进而产生购买行为。

;

;;

;

;;不过，并非所有年轻人都有着惊人的财力，年轻买家靠着“精致穷”买二手也能玩转奢侈品。;

;

;;《2021年中国二手奢侈品行业概览》显示，半数以上的二手奢侈品消费者在30岁以下，过半消;费者的购买原因是价格比新品低。

;

;买了卖，卖了买，市面上的“绝版”货能通过二手方式淘到，双方在买卖中享受着奢侈品流转的快乐。据统计，市场上有超半数的用户选择“既买又卖”，“买卖一体化”趋势显著。

;

;《2023年循环时尚行业趋势报告》显示，2020年国内二手奢侈品市场规模达173亿元，预计2025年或将达到384;亿元。;

;

;;买家淘货的类别多样，主要集中在箱包皮具、服饰鞋帽、高级腕表和珠宝配饰等领域，由于受众广、保值高等原因，箱包皮具成为了二手奢侈品消费者的首选。;

;

;;面对易耗损的高奢化妆品，还有更为实惠的“大牌小样”法。;

;

;;“两三位数的价格就能享受到大牌，何乐而不为？”大三学生小甜是个化妆小白，和许多美妆达人一样，她集齐了各种大牌粉底、口红、香水、护肤品，唯一的区别是她的都是“;小样”：“一个月化妆的次数不超过十次，买正装浪费，买便宜的担心，大牌会心安一点。”

;

;庞大的消费市场驱动下，商家嗅到了商机，不仅“小样”被单独出售，大牌化妆品的分装版也深受追捧。电商平台上，100ml的香奈儿嘉柏丽尔天性香水官方售价约1690元，其10ml的“小样”仅需约130元。但这些产品多是被店名为“XX代购”或其他难以判断正规性的店铺出售，产品鱼龙混杂、真假难辨。

;

;;

;

;;同时，还有一度火出圈的“物尽其;用”法。抖音、小红书等平台曾掀起外包装改造风。一些博主几经折腾，印着品牌logo的包装袋或包装盒就被变身成为纸巾盒、首饰盒，以及可外带的包包，一时间催;热了奢侈品外包装的购买潮流。;

;

;;目前闲鱼上仍有不少人在出售奢侈品外包装，从几十元到上百元不等，前来询价者络绎不绝。;

;

;;

;

;;（;;IC photo / 图）;

;

;;奢侈品争议：;;正品质量堪忧，假货率达80%;

;

;;不;过，奢侈品留给大众的印象不仅是昂贵，还是深陷争议的产品。

;

;首先，网络上几乎每年都会轮番嘲笑某些奢侈品推出的“传奇”单品。比如登上时装周的“搬家专用编织袋”、长满绿草的运动鞋、“葬爱家族”同款杀马特假刘海，还有“躲雨躲个寂寞”的破洞雨伞等等。

;

;不管是不是设计师有意为之，营销效果拉满，即便全网吐槽，也挡不住一批人偷偷下单。

;

;其次，奢侈品购物被各路博主描述为“魔咒”般的体验。“穿便宜衣服进店后被鄙视”“柜姐看不起普通人”……此类购物测评充斥着短视频平台，网络的放大使得不少人产生了对奢侈品店的恐惧。

;

;再者，奢侈品的质量问题饱受诟病。今年2月，福建的张女士在成都旅游时花两万元购入一个香奈儿手袋，结果刚背15分;钟链条就断了。此类问题屡见不鲜，黑猫投诉平台上关于奢侈品的各类投诉层出不穷。;

;

;;网络上有一个流传甚广的段子：如;果买回来的奢侈品包包出现掉色等问题，不用怀疑一定是真货，如果特别结实、耐磨，那就要小心可能是假货了。“要客数据”显示，在品牌官方渠道外的其他渠道中，假货率高达80%以上。目前的中国市场，奢侈品假货数量是真货的6倍。

;

;;

;

;;更让人绷紧神经;的，莫过于近几年频出的奢侈品抄袭问题。去年，迪奥推出的一款中长半身裙撞车中国传统服饰“马面裙”，品牌却称其为“迪奥标志性廓形”。

;

;无独有偶，“马面裙”事件余波未了，迪奥推出2022年的秋冬系列服装，标注原创的迪奥冬季花园图案再一次撞车中国国画“花鸟图”。面对接一连二的抄袭行为，抵制“文化挪用”的声音愈发响亮。

;

;值得注意的是，目前备受追捧的世界级奢侈品依然主要来自海外。反观我国本土品牌，在成为世界名片的路上还有着巨大的成长空间，我们也期待着本土品牌在国际上

;A few days ago, the Ministry of Education issued a notice to launch the first National College Student Career Planning Competition.

;The first National College Student Career Planning Competition, with the theme of "Building Dreams and Aiming for Youth in All Places, Planning to Start Careers and Lead the Future", was co-sponsored by the Ministry of Education and the Shanghai Municipal People's Government. By holding competitions, we strive to create a large classroom that strengthens career education, a large platform that promotes the connection between talent supply and demand, and a large market that serves graduates' employment. We strengthen career education and employment guidance in colleges and universities, enhance college students' awareness of career planning, and guide college students to prepare for employment as early as possible. Better promote high-quality and full employment of college graduates.

;

;The competition will be held from September 2023 to May 2024. It will adopt a three-level competition system of school competition, provincial competition, and national finals. It will set up a growth track, an employment track, and career development and employment guidance courses for college students. The teaching track is for teachers of career development and employment guidance courses for junior and middle school students, senior students and college students in colleges and universities. The school competition is organized by each university, and the provincial competition is organized by each locality. The national finals are hosted by the Shanghai Municipal Education Commission, Fudan University, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, University of Shanghai for Science and Technology, Shanghai Normal University, and Shanghai Vocational College of Arts and Crafts. There are gold, silver, and bronze awards, as well as individual awards, local and university outstanding organizations. Award, Outstanding Instructor Award and other awards.

;

;Registration for the competition will begin on September 20, 2023. At that time, participating students can register through the National College Student Career Planning Competition platform (website: zgs.chsi.com.cn) or designated channels. Registration deadline The time is determined by each locality according to the provincial competition arrangement. During the competition, universities across the country will also hold a series of activities such as employment guidance, campus recruitment, school-enterprise supply and demand matching, and career experience.
